description: Develop custom apps & turbo charge your betting strategy

blocks.name: listCompetitions
blocks.description: Returns a list of Competitions (i.e., World Cup 2013) associated with the markets selected by theMarketFilter. Currently only Football markets have an associated competition.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: filter
args.info: Required: JSON Object. The filter to selectdesired markets. Allmarkets that match thecriteria in the filter areselected. See README for more info.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used forthe response. If notspecified, the default isreturned.

blocks.name: listCountries
blocks.description: Returns a list of Countries associated with the markets selected by the MarketFilter.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: filter
args.info: Required: JSON Object. The filter to selectdesired markets. Allmarkets that match thecriteria in the filter areselected. See README for more info.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used forthe response. If notspecified, the default isreturned.

blocks.name: listMarketBook
blocks.description: Returns a list of dynamic data about markets. Dynamic data includes prices, the status of the market, the status of selections, the traded volume, and the status of any orders you have placed in the market.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: marketIds
args.info: Required: JSON Array. One or more market ids. The number of markets returned depends on the amount of data you request via the price projection.

args.name: orderProjection
args.info: Optionally restricts the results to the specified order status. See README for more info.

args.name: priceProjection
args.info: The projection of price data you want to receive in the response.

args.name: matchProjection
args.info: If you ask for orders, specifies the representation of matches.

args.name: includeOverallPosition
args.info: If you ask for orders, returns matches for each selection. Defaults to true if unspecified.

args.name: partitionMatchedByStrategyRef
args.info: If you ask for orders, returns the breakdown of matches by strategy for each selection. Defaults to false if unspecified.

args.name: customerStrategyRefs
args.info: JSON Array.  If you ask for orders, restricts the results to orders matching any of the specified set of customer defined strategies. Also filters which matches by strategy for selections are returned, if partitionMatchedByStrategyRef is true. An empty set will be treated as if the parameter has been omitted (or null passed).

args.name: currencyCode
args.info: A Betfair standard currency code. If not specified, the default currency code is used.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

args.name: matchedSince
args.info: If you ask for orders, restricts the results to orders that have at least one fragment matched since the specified date (all matched fragments of such an order will be returned even if some were matched before the specified date). All EXECUTABLE orders will be returned regardless of matched date.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

args.name: betIds
args.info: JSON Array. If you ask for orders, restricts the results to orders with the specified bet IDs.

blocks.name: listCurrentOrders
blocks.description: Returns a list of your current orders. Optionally you can filter and sort your current orders using thevarious parameters, setting none of the parameters will return all of your current orders up to a maximumof 1000 bets, ordered BY_BET and sorted EARLIEST_TO_LATEST. To retrieve more than 1000 orders,you need to make use of the fromRecord and recordCount parameters.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: betIds
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified bet IDs. A maximum of 250 betId's, or a combination of 250 betId's & marketId's are permitted.

args.name: marketIds
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified market IDs. A maximum of 250 marketId's, or a combination of 250 marketId's & betId's are permitted.

args.name: orderProjection
args.info: Optionally restricts the results to the specified order status. See README for more info.

args.name: customerOrderRefs
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified customer order references.

args.name: customerStrategyRefs
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified customer strategy references.

args.name: dateRange
args.info: Optionally restricts the results to be from/to the specified date, these dates are contextual to the orders being returned and therefore the dates used to filter on will change to placed, matched, voided or settled dates depending on the orderBy. This date is inclusive, i.e. if an order was placed on exactly this date (to the millisecond) then it will be included in the results. If the from is later than the to, no results will be returned. See README for more info.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Specifies how the results will be ordered. If no value is passed in, it defaults to BY_BET.  Also acts as a filter such that only orders with a valid value in the field being ordered by will be returned (i.e. BY_VOID_TIME returns only voided orders, BY_SETTLED_TIME (applies to partially settled markets) returns only settled orders and BY_MATCH_TIME returns only orders with a matched date (voided, settled, matched orders)). Note that specifying an orderBy parameter defines the context of the date filter applied by the dateRange parameter (placed, matched, voided or settled date) - see the dateRange parameter description (above) for more information. See also the OrderBy type definition.

args.name: sortDir
args.info: Specifies the direction the results will be sorted in. If no value is passed in, it defaults to EARLIEST_TO_LATEST.

args.name: fromRecord
args.info: Specifies the first record that will be returned. Records start at index zero, not at index one.

args.name: recordCount
args.info: Specifies how many records will be returned from the index position 'fromRecord'. Note that there is a page size limit of 1000. A value of zero indicates that you would like all records (including and from 'fromRecord') up to the limit.

blocks.name: listClearedOrders
blocks.description: Returns a list of settled bets based on the bet status, ordered by settled date. To retrieve more than 1000 records, you need to make use of the fromRecord and recordCount parameters. By default the service will return all available data for the last 90 days (see Best Practice note below).

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: betStatus
args.info: Required: Restricts the results to the specified status.

args.name: eventTypeIds
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified Event Type IDs.

args.name: eventIds
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified Event IDs.

args.name: marketIds
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified market IDs.

args.name: runnerIds
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified Runners.

args.name: betIds
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified bet IDs.

args.name: customerOrderRefs
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified customer order references.

args.name: customerStrategyRefs
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified customer strategy references.

args.name: side
args.info: Optionally restricts the results to the specified side.

args.name: settledDateRange
args.info: Optionally restricts the results to be from/to the specified settled date. This date is inclusive, i.e. if an order was cleared on exactly this date (to the millisecond) then it will be included in the results. If the from is later than the to, no results will be returned.

args.name: groupBy
args.info: How to aggregate the lines, if not supplied then the lowest level is returned, i.e. bet by bet This is only applicable to SETTLED BetStatus.

args.name: includeItemDescription
args.info: If true then an ItemDescription object is included in the response.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used for the itemDescription. If not specified, the customer account default is returned.

args.name: fromRecord
args.info: Specifies the first record that will be returned. Records start at index zero.

args.name: recordCount
args.info: Specifies how many records will be returned, from the index position 'fromRecord'. Note that there is a page size limit of 1000. A value of zero indicates that you would like all records (including and from 'fromRecord') up to the limit.

blocks.name: listEvents
blocks.description: Returns a list of Events (i.e, Reading vs. Man United) associated with the markets selected by the MarketFilter.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: filter
args.info: Required: JSON Object. The filter to select desired markets. All markets that match the criteria in the filter are selected. See README for more info.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

blocks.name: listEventTypes
blocks.description: Returns a list of Event Types (i.e. Sports) associated with the markets selected by the MarketFilter.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: filter
args.info: Required: JSON Object. The filter to select desired markets. All markets that match the criteria in the filter are selected. See README for more info.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

blocks.name: listMarketCatalogue
blocks.description: Returns a list of information about published (ACTIVE/SUSPENDED) markets that does not change (or changes very rarely). You use listMarketCatalogue to retrieve the name of the market, the names of selections and other information about markets.  Market Data Request Limits apply to requests made to listMarketCatalogue. Please note: listMarketCatalogue does not return markets that are CLOSED.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: filter
args.info: Required: JSON Object. The filter to select desired markets. All markets that match the criteria in the filter are selected. See README for more info.

args.name: marketProjection
args.info: JSON Array. The type and amount of data returned about the market.

args.name: sort
args.info: The order of the results. Will default to RANK if not passed. RANK is an assigned priority that is determined by our Market Operations team in our back-end system. A result's overall rank is derived from the ranking given to the flowing attributes for the result. EventType, Competition, StartTime, MarketType, MarketId. For example, EventType is ranked by the most popular sports types and marketTypes are ranked in the following order: ODDS ASIAN LINE RANGE If all other dimensions of the result are equal, then the results are ranked in MarketId order.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Required: limit on the total number of results returned, must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1000.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

blocks.name: listMarketProfitAndLoss
blocks.description: Retrieve profit and loss for a given list of OPEN markets. The values are calculated using matched bets and optionally settled bets. Only odds (MarketBettingType = ODDS) markets  are implemented, markets of other types are silently ignored. To retrieve your profit and loss for CLOSED markets, please use the listClearedOrders request.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: marketIds
args.info: Required: JSON Array. List of markets to calculate profit and loss

args.name: includeSettledBets
args.info: Option to include settled bets (partially settled markets only). Defaults to false if not specified.

args.name: includeBspBets
args.info: Option to include BSP bets. Defaults to false if not specified.

args.name: netOfCommission
args.info: Option to return profit and loss net of users current commission rate for this market including any special tariffs. Defaults to false if not specified.

blocks.name: listMarketTypes
blocks.description: Returns a list of market types (i.e. MATCH_ODDS, NEXT_GOAL) associated with the markets selected by the MarketFilter. The market types are always the same, regardless of locale.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: filter
args.info: Required: JSON Object. The filter to select desired markets. All markets that match the criteria in the filter are selected. See README for more info.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

blocks.name: listTimeRanges
blocks.description: Returns a list of time ranges in the granularity specified in the request (i.e. 3PM to 4PM, Aug 14th to Aug 15th) associated with the markets selected by the MarketFilter.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: filter
args.info: Required: JSON Object. The filter to select desired markets. All markets that match the criteria in the filter are selected. See README for more info.

args.name: granularity
args.info: Required: The granularity of time periods that correspond to markets selected by the market filter.

blocks.name: listVenues
blocks.description: Returns a list of Venues (i.e. Cheltenham, Ascot) associated with the markets selected by the MarketFilter. Currently, only Horse Racing markets are associated with a Venue.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: filter
args.info: Required: JSON Object. The filter to select desired markets. All markets that match the criteria in the filter are selected. See README for more info.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

blocks.name: placeOrders
blocks.description: Place new orders into market. This operation is atomic in that all orders will be placed or none will be placed. Please note that additional bet sizing rules apply to bets placed into the Italian Exchange.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: marketId
args.info: Required: The market id these orders are to be placed on

args.name: instructions
args.info: Required: JSON Array of Objects. The number of place instructions. The limit of place instructions per request is 200 for the UK/AUS Exchange and 50 for the Italian Exchange. See README for more info.

args.name: customerRef
args.info: Optional parameter allowing the client to pass a unique string (up to 32 chars) that is used to de-dupe mistaken re-submissions.   CustomerRef can contain: upper/lower chars, digits, chars : - . _ + * : ; ~ only. Please note: There is a time window associated with the de-duplication of duplicate submissions which is 60 seconds.

args.name: marketVersion
args.info: JSON Object. Optional parameter allowing the client to specify which version of the market the orders should be placed on. If the current market version is higher than that sent on an order, the bet will be lapsed. See README for more info.

args.name: customerStrategyRef
args.info: An optional reference customers can use to specify which strategy has sent the order. The reference will be returned on order change messages through the stream API. The string is limited to 15 characters. If an empty string is provided it will be treated as null.

args.name: async
args.info: An optional flag (not setting equates to false) which specifies if the orders should be placed asynchronously. Orders can be tracked via the Exchange Stream API or or the API-NG by providing a customerOrderRef for each place order. An order's status will be PENDING and no bet ID will be returned.

blocks.name: cancelOrders
blocks.description: Cancel all bets OR cancel all bets on a market OR fully or partially cancel particular orders on a market. Only LIMIT orders can be cancelled or partially cancelled once placed.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: marketId
args.info: If marketId and betId aren't supplied all bets are cancelled

args.name: instructions
args.info: JSON Array of Object. All instructions need to be on the same market. If not supplied all bets on the market (if market id is passed) are fully cancelled.  The limit of cancel instructions per request is 60. See README for more info.

args.name: customerRef
args.info: Optional parameter allowing the client to pass a unique string (up to 32 chars) that is used to de-dupe mistaken re-submissions.

blocks.name: replaceOrders
blocks.description: This operation is logically a bulk cancel followed by a bulk place. The cancel is completed first then the new orders are placed. The new orders will be placed atomically in that they will all be placed or none will be placed. In the case where the new orders cannot be placed the cancellations will not be rolled back. See ReplaceInstruction.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: marketId
args.info: Required: The market id these orders are to be placed on

args.name: instructions
args.info: Required: JSON Array of Objects. The number of replace instructions. The limit of replace instructions per request is 60. See README for more info.

args.name: customerRef
args.info: Optional parameter allowing the client to pass a unique string (up to 32 chars) that is used to de-dupe mistaken re-submissions.

args.name: marketVersion
args.info: Optional parameter allowing the client to specify which version of the market the orders should be placed on. If the current market version is higher than that sent on an order, the bet will be lapsed.

args.name: async
args.info: An optional flag (not setting equates to false) which specifies if the orders should be replaced asynchronously. Orders can be tracked via the Exchange Stream API or the API-NG by providing a customerOrderRef for each replace order. Not available for MOC or LOC bets.

blocks.name: updateOrders
blocks.description: Update non-exposure changing fields

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: marketId
args.info: Required: The market id these orders are to be placed on

args.name: instructions
args.info: Required: JSON Array of Objects. The number of update instructions. The limit of update instructions per request is 60. See README for more info.

args.name: customerRef
args.info: Optional parameter allowing the client to pass a unique string (up to 32 chars) that is used to de-dupe mistaken re-submissions.

blocks.name: createDeveloperAppKeys
blocks.description: Create 2 Application Keys for given user; one 'Delayed and the other 'Live'. You must apply to have your 'Live' App Key activated.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: appName
args.info: Required: A Display name for the application.

blocks.name: getAccountDetails
blocks.description: Returns the details relating your account, including your discount rate and Betfair point balance.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

blocks.name: getAccountFunds
blocks.description: Get available to bet amount. The getAccounts service will return the UK wallet balance by default from either the UK or AUS Accounts API endpoint if the wallet parameter is not specified.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: wallet
args.info: Name of the wallet in question. Please Note: To return the the Australian Exchange wallet balance you must specify AUSTRALIAN as the Wallet parameter.

blocks.name: getDeveloperAppKeys
blocks.description: Get all application keys owned by the given developer/vendor

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

blocks.name: getAccountStatement
blocks.description: Get account statement

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: locale
args.info: The language to be used where applicable. If not specified, the customer account default is returned.

args.name: fromRecord
args.info: Specifies the first record that will be returned. Records start at index zero. If not specified then it will default to 0.

args.name: recordCount
args.info: Specifies the maximum number of records to be returned. Note that there is a page size limit of 100.

args.name: itemDateRange
args.info: JSON Object. Return items with an itemDate within this date range. Both from and to date times are inclusive. If from is not specified then the oldest available items will be in range. If to is not specified then the latest items will be in range. nb. This itemDataRange is currently only applied when includeItem is set to ALL or not specified, else items are NOT bound by itemDate. See README for more info.

args.name: includeItem
args.info: Which items to include, if not specified then defaults to ALL.

blocks.name: listCurrencyRates
blocks.description: Returns a list of currency rates based on given currency. Please note: the currency rates are updated once every hour a few seconds after the hour.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: fromCurrency
args.info: The currency from which the rates are computed. Please note: GBP is currently the only based currency support

blocks.name: cancelApplicationSubscription
blocks.description: Cancel the subscription token. The customers subscription will no longer be active once cancelled.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: subscriptionToken
args.info: Required: Subscription token for activation.

blocks.name: getApplicationSubscriptionHistory
blocks.description: Returns a list of subscriptions tokens that have been associated with the customers account.  This allows a vendor to identify if a customer has a previous subscription to their application and the status of each subscription.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: vendorClientId
args.info: The unique customer identifier

args.name: applicationKey
args.info: The unique application identifier

blocks.name: getApplicationSubscriptionToken
blocks.description: Used to create new subscription tokens for an application. Returns the newly generated subscription token which can be provided to the end user. Please note: A maximum number of 15,000 subscription UNACTIVATED subscriptions tokens can be created at any one time. Attempts to create more subscription tokens will return the error TOO_MANY_REQUESTS error which will restrict creation of further tokens until existing UNACTIVATED subscription tokens have been ACTIVATED or CANCELLED

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: subscriptionLength
args.info: How many days the subscription should last. Open ended if value not supplied. Expiry time will be rounded up to midnight on the date of expiry.

args.name: clientReference
args.info: Any client reference for this subscription token request.

blocks.name: listAccountSubscriptionTokens
blocks.description: List of subscription tokens associated with the account

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

blocks.name: activateApplicationSubscription
blocks.description: Activates the customers subscription token for an application. Please note: The request is made by the customers account using their session token (X-Authentication header) only.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: subscriptionToken
args.info: Required: Subscription token for activation.

blocks.name: listApplicationSubscriptionTokens
blocks.description: Returns a list of subscription tokens for an application based on the subscription status passed in the request. Returns all subscription token details, including the client reference and vendor client Id associated with the subscription token.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: subscriptionStatus
args.info: Optionally filter response by Subscription status of the token

blocks.name: updateApplicationSubscription
blocks.description: Update an application subscription with a new expiry date. Please note: A subscription token created by this operation *doesn't* need to be activated via activateApplicationSubscription as the token is automatically associated with the customers vendorClientId when the request is made.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: vendorClientId
args.info: Required: The vendor client id for which to update the subscription for

args.name: subscriptionLength
args.info: Required: How many days the subscription should last. Expiry time will be rounded up to midnight on the date of expiry. Any change to the subscription length will override the customers existing subscription.

blocks.name: getVendorClientId
blocks.description: Returns the vendor client id for customer account which is a unique identifier for that customer.  The vendor client Id can be used to obtain the customers application subscription history via getApplicationSubscriptionHistory.  The request requires the X-Authentication header only

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

blocks.name: getAffiliateRelation
blocks.description: Return relation between a list of users and an affiliate

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: vendorClientIds
args.info: JSON Array. List of client ids to check affiliation on

blocks.name: getVendorDetails
blocks.description: Return details about a vendor from its identifier. Response includes Vendor Name and URL.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: vendorId
args.info: Required: The vendor's public identifier

blocks.name: checkAccountSubscriptionToWebApp
blocks.description: Return whether an account has authorised a web app.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: vendorId
args.info: Required: The id of the vendor to check subscription for

blocks.name: revokeAccessToWebApp
blocks.description: Remove the link between an account and a vendor web app. This will remove the refreshToken for this user-vendor pair subscription.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: vendorId
args.info: Required: Returns whether the request was successful or not

blocks.name: generateVendorAccessToken
blocks.description: Generate web vendor session based on a standard session identifiable by auth code, vendor secret and app key

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: The vendor's vendorId

args.name: grantType
args.info: Required: Whether the vendor is using an authorisation code or a refresh token to get a session

args.name: code
args.info: The authorisation code used to lookup the session to be returned

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: The vendor's private key used to verify their identity

args.name: refreshToken
args.info: The vendor's refresh token if the grant_type is refresh_token

blocks.name: startSession
blocks.description: The API login endpoint is the simplest method of integration for most applications in terms of expected development time but comes at the cost of being less flexible to edge-cases than the embedded Betfair embedded login page. It will allow a user to provide a username and password or a username and (password + 2 factor auth code) if they have strong authentication enabled.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: username
args.info: Required: The username to be used for the login

args.name: password
args.info: The password to be used for the login. For strong auth customers, this should be their password with a 2 factor auth code appended to the password string.

blocks.name: endSession
blocks.description: You can use Logout to terminate your existing session.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

blocks.name: extendSession
blocks.description: You can use Keep Alive to extend the session timeout period. The minimum session time is currently 20 minutes (Italian Exchange). On the international (.com) Exchange the current session time is 4 hours. Therefore, you should request Keep Alive within this time to prevent session expiry. If you don't call Keep Alive within the specified timeout period, the session will expire. Please note:  Session times aren't determined or extended based on API activity.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

blocks.name: startSslSession
blocks.description: The non-interactive login method for API-NG requires that you create and upload a self-signed certificate which will be used, alongside your username and password to authenticate your credentials and generate a session token.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: password
args.info: Required: The password of the user logging in.

args.name: username
args.info: Required: The username to be used for the login

args.name: cert
args.info: Required: cert file

args.name: key
args.info: Required: key file

blocks.name: listRaceDetails
blocks.description: Search for races to get their details.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: meetingIds
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified meeting IDs. The unique Id for the meeting equivalent to the eventId for that specific race as returned by listEvents.  Optionally restricts the results to the specified meeting IDs.

args.name: raceIds
args.info: JSON Array. Optionally restricts the results to the specified race IDs. The unique Id for the race in the format meetingid.raceTime (hhmm). raceTime is in GMT.  Optionally restricts the results to the specified race IDs.

blocks.name: heartbeat
blocks.description: This heartbeat operation is provided to help customers have their positions managed automatically in the event of their API clients losing connectivity with the Betfair API. If a heartbeat request is not received within a prescribed time period, then Betfair will attempt to cancel all 'LIMIT' type bets for the given customer on the given exchange. There is no guarantee that this service will result in all bets being cancelled as there are a number of circumstances where bets are unable to be cancelled. Manual intervention is strongly advised in the event of a loss of connectivity to ensure that positions are correctly managed. If this service becomes unavailable for any reason, then your heartbeat will be unregistered automatically to avoid bets being inadvertently cancelled upon resumption of service. you should manage your position manually until the service is resumed. Heartbeat data may also be lost in the unlikely event of nodes failing within the cluster, which may result in your position not being managed until a subsequent heartbeat request is received.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: The Betfair Application Key.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Required: The Betfair Session Token.

args.name: preferredTimeoutSeconds
args.info: Maximum period in seconds that may elapse (without a subsequent heartbeat request), before a cancellation request is automatically submitted on your behalf. The minimum value is 10, the maximum value permitted is 300. Passing 0 will result in your heartbeat being unregistered (or ignored if you have no current heartbeat registered). You will still get an actionPerformed value returned when passing 0, so this may be used to determine if any action was performed since your last heartbeat, without actually registering a new heartbeat. Passing a negative value will result in an error being returned, INVALID_INPUT_DATA. Any errors while registering your heartbeat will result in a error being returned, UNEXPECTED_ERROR. Passing a value that is less than the minimum timeout will result in your heartbeat adopting the minimum timeout. Passing a value that is greater than the maximum timeout will result in your heartbeat adopting the maximum timeout. The minimum and maximum timeouts are subject to change, so your client should utilise the returned actualTimeoutSeconds to set an appropriate frequency for your subsequent heartbeat requests.
